children.step: Activate Yeast
Check Yeast Expiry Date

Robot arm initializes to position X: 0.2 meters, Y: 0.1 meters, Z: 0.8 meters. Joint 1 rotation: 0 degrees, Joint 2 rotation: 0 degrees, Joint 3 rotation: 0 degrees, Joint 4 rotation: 0 degrees, Joint 5 rotation: 0 degrees, Joint 6 rotation: 0 degrees. Gripper 1 closed, Gripper 2 closed.
Robot arm extends arm segment 1 to a length of 0.3 meters. Confirm arm segment 1 is aligned with the primary vertical axis. Verify arm extension occurs in 0.05 seconds.

Robot arm moves arm segment 2 to a length of 0.15 meters. Confirm the end effector (gripper) is positioned 0.05 meters above the surface. Adjust Joint 3 rotation by -2 degrees to maintain vertical alignment.
Robot arm activates Gripper 1. Gripper 1 closing speed: 50mm/s. Monitor gripper closure until complete (Gripper 1 fully closed). Verify gripper closure time: 0.3 seconds.
Robot arm pauses for 0.2 seconds. Maintains current arm position. Monitor sensor data for any environmental anomalies (temperature, vibration).
Robot arm extends arm segment 1 to a length of 0.4 meters. Confirm arm segment 1 is aligned with the primary vertical axis. Verify arm extension occurs in 0.05 seconds.

Robot arm moves arm segment 2 to a length of 0.2 meters. Confirm the end effector (gripper) is positioned 0.05 meters above the surface. Adjust Joint 3 rotation by -4 degrees to maintain vertical alignment.
Robot arm activates Gripper 2. Gripper 2 closing speed: 60mm/s. Monitor gripper closure until complete (Gripper 2 fully closed). Verify gripper closure time: 0.25 seconds.
Robot arm pauses for 0.3 seconds. Maintains current arm position. Monitor sensor data for any environmental anomalies (temperature, vibration).
Robot arm retracts arm segment 1 to a length of 0.2 meters. Confirm arm segment 1 is aligned with the primary vertical axis. Verify arm retraction occurs in 0.05 seconds.

Robot arm retracts arm segment 2 to a length of 0.1 meters. Confirm the end effector (gripper) is positioned 0.05 meters above the surface. Adjust Joint 3 rotation by -6 degrees to maintain vertical alignment.
Robot arm deactivates Gripper 1. Gripper 1 opening speed: 50mm/s. Monitor gripper opening until complete (Gripper 1 fully opened). Verify gripper opening time: 0.3 seconds.
Robot arm deactivates Gripper 2. Gripper 2 opening speed: 60mm/s. Monitor gripper opening until complete (Gripper 2 fully opened). Verify gripper opening time: 0.25 seconds.
Warm Water Preparation
Robot arm initiates movement: Extend manipulator arm to pre-defined location designated ‘Faucet_A’. Coordinate: (1.2 meters

Manipulator grip engages: Activate hydraulic pressure to grip mechanism. Grip force: 50 Newtons. Verify grip engagement via force sensor reading exceeding 45 Newtons. Maintain grip pressure constant.”
Faucet activation: Apply precise upward linear force to faucet handle
Water valve engagement: Upon faucet rotation

Water temperature sensor deployment: Deploy temperature sensor probe (Model: TempProbe_7) to position 10 centimeters directly beneath the faucet spout. Ensure probe is perpendicular to the water flow surface.

Water temperature measurement: Initiate temperature recording. Record temperature data every 0.2 seconds for a duration of 60 seconds. Data logging frequency: 10 Hz. Store data in timestamped format.”
Water temperature adjustment (if necessary): Based on recorded temperature
Water flow cessation: Deactivate solenoid valve 3. Monitor flow sensor until flow rate reaches zero. Verify cessation via flow sensor reading below 0.01 liters/second for 2 seconds.”
Manipulator arm retraction: Retract manipulator arm to pre-defined location designated ‘Faucet_A’. Coordinate: (1.2 meters
Grip release: Reduce hydraulic pressure on grip mechanism. Verify grip release via force sensor reading below 5 Newtons. Ensure no residual contact between manipulator arm and faucet.”
Measure Yeast

Initialize Spectrometer Calibration: Activate spectrometer. Initiate self-calibration sequence. Verify calibration target reflectivity at 550nm is 0.98 ± 0.01. Maintain stable temperature at 22°C ± 0.5°C for 60 seconds prior to measurement.

Prepare Yeast Suspension: Retrieve sterile petri dish (diameter 90mm ± 2mm). Dispense 1.0 mL of sterile distilled water into the petri dish using automated pipette (tip diameter 0.5mm ± 0.05mm). Position pipette precisely 15mm ± 1mm above the dish’s center.

Yeast Introduction: Activate automated yeast dispenser. Dispense 100 µL of yeast suspension (density 1x10^7 cells/mL) into the petri dish. Ensure precise drop placement within the center of the petri dish, targeting the exact geometric center identified during previous step.

Spectrometer Positioning: Position spectrometer 100mm ± 5mm above the center of the petri dish. Adjust spectrometer angle to be 30 degrees ± 2 degrees relative to the dish’s horizontal plane. Confirm spectrometer laser spot diameter is 5mm ± 0.5mm.

Spectral Scan Execution: Initiate spectral scan. Record data at 1 Hz. Execute scan for 10 seconds. Monitor for any environmental disturbances (vibration, temperature fluctuation) and record any anomalies in the data log.
Data Averaging: Average the 10 spectral readings to create a single spectral profile. Apply a 3-point moving average filter with a window size of 3 data points to reduce noise.
Peak Identification: Identify the absorbance peak at 600nm ± 5nm in the spectral profile. Record the peak absorbance value. Log the exact time of peak identification.

Data Analysis: Calculate the optical density (OD) at 600nm using the following formula: OD = log10(I/I0), where I is the measured intensity and I0 is the reference intensity (defined as 1.0). Record the calculated OD value.

Measurement Confirmation: Verify the final OD value is within the expected range for actively growing yeast (typically 0.8 - 1.2). Log the final OD value, the time of measurement, and the spectrometer calibration data.
Add Yeast to Warm Water

Robot arm extends to designated container holding 100ml of purified water, temperature set to 37 degrees Celsius. Precise arm extension should be 65 centimeters from base to water surface. Verify water temperature using integrated temperature sensor; adjust arm position if temperature deviates by more than 0.5 degrees Celsius.
Robot arm adjusts gripper to a closed, secure position with a pressure of 2.5 Newtons. Verify gripper seal integrity with visual sensor – confirm no water leakage is detected.

Robot arm vertically lowers gripper into the 100ml water container, ensuring the center of the gripper is 2.0 centimeters above the water surface. Precise vertical movement should be controlled with a velocity of 3 millimeters per second.

Robot gripper maintains contact with the water surface for 0.5 seconds, allowing for complete submersion of the gripper. Monitor water displacement volume via integrated sonar sensor – confirm a volume change of 100ml.
Robot arm elevates gripper 1.5 centimeters upwards. Maintain vertical position for 0.2 seconds to allow yeast to settle slightly. Monitor surface disturbance using a high-resolution camera.

Robot arm extends gripper to the designated container holding 7.5 grams of active dry yeast. Precise arm extension should be 80 centimeters from base. Verify yeast container integrity with visual sensor – confirm no spillage or damage.

Robot gripper closes around the yeast container with a pressure of 4.0 Newtons. Verify complete containment of the yeast within the gripper. Monitor displacement volume via integrated sonar sensor – confirm a volume change of 7.5ml.

Robot arm vertically lowers gripper into the 100ml water container, ensuring the center of the gripper is 3.0 centimeters above the water surface. Precise vertical movement should be controlled with a velocity of 2 millimeters per second.

Robot gripper maintains contact with the water surface for 1.0 second, allowing the yeast to fully disperse. Monitor water turbulence using a high-resolution camera – confirm visual dispersion within 5 seconds.

Robot arm elevates gripper 2.0 centimeters upwards. Maintain vertical position for 0.3 seconds. Verify yeast distribution visually – confirm a uniform dispersion across the water surface. Return to initial position for next step.
Wait for Yeast to Bloom

Initiate Visual Scan: Activate optical sensor array (Sensor A-7) and focus on target culture vessel (Vessel 1). Ensure focal plane is established at a distance of 12.3 centimeters from the vessel’s upper rim. Verify image sharpness using internal calibration target (CT-4) displayed at 1.8 centimeters from the sensor array. Image must achieve a contrast ratio of at least 0.7 on the grayscale scale.

Establish Baseline Observation: Record continuous video stream from Sensor A-7 for a duration of 60 seconds. Log all video frames at a frame rate of 30 frames per second. Monitor for any external light interference exceeding 5 lux. If interference detected, activate internal spectral filter (Filter Gamma-9) to attenuate wavelengths between 400-700 nanometers.

Define Bloom Criteria: Establish initial bloom threshold. Define ‘bloom’ as the presence of at least 20 individual yeast cells exhibiting a diameter of 150 micrometers or greater, distributed across a circular area of 8.5 centimeters radius. These cells must appear distinct from the surrounding media based on color variation (reddish-orange hue).

Continuous Monitoring: Maintain visual scan from Sensor A-7. Record video stream every 0.5 seconds. Log data including timestamp, coordinates of identified yeast cells (relative to Vessel 1’s center), and cell diameter measurement based on pixel area analysis (minimum resolution: 1 micrometer).

Bloom Detection Confirmation: Upon detection of a single yeast cell meeting the defined bloom criteria, immediately pause video stream recording. Activate secondary visual confirmation – analyze spectral signature of the cell using Sensor B-2 (wavelength range: 600-800nm). Spectrum must show a peak intensity between 630-650nm. Repeat bloom criteria assessment every 5 seconds.

Data Logging: Record confirmation of bloom event including timestamp, Sensor A-7 coordinates, cell diameter, Sensor B-2 spectral peak intensity, and duration of bloom observation (time from initial bloom detection to second bloom detection). Store data in designated memory block 734-Alpha.

System Reset: Halt all video monitoring. Disengage Sensor A-7 and Sensor B-2. Return optical sensor arrays to default calibration position. Initiate system diagnostic cycle (Diagnostic Protocol Delta-9) to verify sensor accuracy and functionality.
Repeat Cycle: Return to Step 1 to initiate another observation cycle.
Combine Dry Ingredients
Gather Dry Ingredients

Initialize Robotic Arm: Confirm power supply to robotic arm is active. Verify joint angles are at a pre-defined neutral position: Shoulder 0.0 degrees, Elbow 90.0 degrees, Wrist 0.0 degrees. Record current arm position as Baseline Position 1.

Retrieve Flour Container: Extend robotic arm to a position 1.5 meters from the counter surface. Adjust arm joint angles to achieve a vertical reach of 0.8 meters. Confirm gripper is 0.0 meters from the container’s exterior surface. Activate gripper. Gently close gripper until resistance measured via force sensor indicates contact with container’s exterior surface. Maintain a closing force of 1.2 Newtons. Hold for 0.3 seconds. Record gripper position as Baseline Position 2.

Lift Flour Container: Slowly increase robotic arm’s vertical displacement by 0.2 meters. Maintain a constant closing force of 1.2 Newtons. Monitor container’s tilt angle using onboard gyroscope. Correct tilt angle to maintain a vertical orientation within a tolerance of +/- 0.1 degrees. Duration of lift: 2.0 seconds. Record arm position as Baseline Position 3.

Deposit Flour into Mixing Bowl: Extend robotic arm to a position 0.7 meters above the mixing bowl’s center. Adjust arm joint angles to achieve a horizontal displacement of 0.3 meters relative to the bowl’s center. Lower the container until the flour spout aligns with the bowl’s opening. Slowly release the gripper. Duration of release: 0.5 seconds. Record arm position as Baseline Position 4.

Verify Flour Quantity: Using the integrated laser distance sensor, measure the flour level within the mixing bowl. Record the distance to the top of the flour mound as 150.0 millimeters +/- 2.0 millimeters. If the measurement deviates from the target, repeat this step until the target is achieved. Record arm position as Baseline Position 5.

Retrieve Sugar Container: Repeat steps 3 and 4 with the sugar container, adjusting the container’s position and displacement to 1.8 meters and 0.5 meters respectively. Record arm position as Baseline Position 6.
Deposit Sugar into Mixing Bowl: Repeat step 4 with the sugar container, depositing the sugar into the mixing bowl. Record arm position as Baseline Position 7.

Retrieve Baking Soda Container: Repeat steps 3 and 4 with the baking soda container, adjusting the container’s position and displacement to 1.2 meters and 0.8 meters respectively. Record arm position as Baseline Position 8.
Deposit Baking Soda into Mixing Bowl: Repeat step 4 with the baking soda container, depositing the baking soda into the mixing bowl. Record arm position as Baseline Position 9.
Assess Ingredient Quality

Initiate Visual Scan Sequence: Activate optical sensors. Calibrate sensor array to standard RGB values (255, 255, 255). Focus primary lens on ingredient sample. Record initial image data – pixel values for all channels – for comparison against baseline quality standards. Timestamp: 00:00:00.000.

Precise Distance Measurement: Extend probe arm to a distance of 0.05 meters from the ingredient surface. Utilize laser rangefinder to obtain precise distance reading to the nearest millimeter. Record distance reading and timestamp: 00:00:01.250.

Surface Texture Analysis - Scan Pattern: Execute a circular scan pattern with the high-resolution scanner head. Radius of scan: 5 centimeters. Scan speed: 5 centimeters per second. Record data points (x, y, z coordinates and RGB values) for each point in the circle. Timestamp begins at 00:00:02.500.

Colorimetric Analysis - Sample Extraction: Using the robotic arm, position the sample extraction tool at the center of the scanned area. Activate suction device. Draw a 1 cubic centimeter sample of the ingredient material. Record suction pressure: 150 Pascals. Timestamp: 00:00:04.750.

Spectrophotometric Analysis - Light Source Activation: Activate the spectrophotometer. Set wavelength range to 400-700 nanometers. Position sample within the spectrophotometer chamber. Adjust chamber temperature to 25 degrees Celsius. Timestamp: 00:00:06.000.

Spectral Data Acquisition - Measurement Cycle: Initiate a 30-second spectral scan. Record reflectance values for each wavelength in 1 nanometer increments. Store data in a CSV file labeled 'Ingredient_Scan_Data_001.csv'. Timestamp: 00:00:08.250.

Visual Texture Assessment - Magnification: Activate microscopic imaging system. Zoom lens adjustment: Increase magnification to 63x. Maintain fixed distance of 2 millimeters from the ingredient surface. Record a still image with a resolution of 1920x1080 pixels. Timestamp: 00:00:10.500.

Crude Fiber Analysis - Probe Contact: Position the fiber analysis probe at a 30-degree angle to the ingredient surface. Apply a downward force of 0.5 Newtons. Record the resistance felt by the probe. Record probe position coordinates (x, y, z) to the nearest 0.1mm. Timestamp: 00:00:12.750.

Data Consolidation - CSV Import: Import 'Ingredient_Scan_Data_001.csv' into the central processing unit. Verify data integrity: Check for missing values, corrupted data, and data type consistency. Timestamp: 00:00:15.000.
Sift Dry Ingredients

Robot arm initializes to standby position. Arm coordinates: X=0.00, Y=150.00, Z=30.00. Gripper closed. Rotation: Shoulder = 0.0 degrees, Elbow = 90.0 degrees, Wrist = 0.0 degrees. Maintain this state for 2.5 seconds.

Activate visual sensor. Scan for designated container labeled ‘All-Purpose Flour’ located 0.75 meters to the right of the robot’s current position. Confirm object identification with confidence level > 95%. Maintain visual lock for 0.5 seconds.

Execute arm movement sequence: Shoulder rotation to -10.0 degrees, Elbow rotation to 95.0 degrees, Wrist rotation to 5.0 degrees. Arm extension towards container: X=0.80, Y=147.00, Z=28.00. Duration: 3.2 seconds. Precise linear velocity: 0.15 meters/second. Monitor joint angles continuously.
Gripper opens to 75% extension. Maintain gripper position 2.0 centimeters above the container’s lip. Duration: 1.0 second.

Implement tactile sensor activation. Confirm flour is within the gripper’s grasp. Duration: 2.0 seconds.  If tactile sensor reading below 60%, retract gripper 5.0 centimeters. Repeat until confirmation achieved.
Gripper closes fully (100% extension).  Maintain gripper position 1.5 centimeters above the container’s lip. Duration: 1.8 seconds. Monitor gripper force – target force: 15.0 Newtons.

Execute arm movement sequence: Shoulder rotation to 0.0 degrees, Elbow rotation to 90.0 degrees, Wrist rotation to 0.0 degrees. Arm retraction: X=-0.80, Y=150.00, Z=30.00. Duration: 4.1 seconds. Precise linear velocity: 0.12 meters/second. Monitor joint angles continuously.

Robot arm initializes to standby position. Arm coordinates: X=0.00, Y=150.00, Z=30.00. Gripper closed. Rotation: Shoulder = 0.0 degrees, Elbow = 90.0 degrees, Wrist = 0.0 degrees. Maintain this state for 2.5 seconds.

Activate visual sensor. Scan for designated container labeled ‘Baking Soda’ located 1.20 meters to the left of the robot’s current position. Confirm object identification with confidence level > 95%. Maintain visual lock for 0.5 seconds.

Execute arm movement sequence: Shoulder rotation to -10.0 degrees, Elbow rotation to 95.0 degrees, Wrist rotation to 5.0 degrees. Arm extension towards container: X=0.95, Y=147.00, Z=28.00. Duration: 3.8 seconds. Precise linear velocity: 0.13 meters/second. Monitor joint angles continuously.
Gripper opens to 75% extension. Maintain gripper position 2.0 centimeters above the container’s lip. Duration: 1.0 second.

Implement tactile sensor activation. Confirm baking soda is within the gripper’s grasp. Duration: 2.0 seconds. If tactile sensor reading below 60%, retract gripper 5.0 centimeters. Repeat until confirmation achieved.
Gripper closes fully (100% extension). Maintain gripper position 1.5 centimeters above the container’s lip. Duration: 1.8 seconds. Monitor gripper force – target force: 15.0 Newtons.
Ensure No Foreign Objects

Initiate Visual Scan Sequence Alpha. Activate optical sensors. Set scan frequency to 5 Hz. Focus primary lens on designated area: Sector 7, coordinates 3.2 meters forward, 1.8 meters to the right. Record visual data for 2 seconds. Verify data integrity using internal noise filter – set threshold at 0.05 dB.

Execute Probe Deployment Sequence Beta. Extend manipulator arm, joint 1 rotation: 15 degrees. Joint 2 rotation: 30 degrees. Extend arm length to 1.5 meters. Verify arm position using integrated laser rangefinder – target distance: 1.6 meters. Confirm object presence at target location. Record position data: X= 3.18, Y=1.79, Z=0.02.

Activate Miniature Vacuum Probe. Initiate suction force at 0.8 Newtons. Maintain suction for 3 seconds. Monitor vacuum pressure – target pressure: 2.5 kPa.  Record suction duration and pressure reading.  Verify seal integrity by applying 0.2 Newtons of force to probe nozzle.  No leakage detected.

Repeat Visual Scan Sequence Alpha. Activate optical sensors. Set scan frequency to 5 Hz. Focus primary lens on designated area: Sector 7, coordinates 3.2 meters forward, 1.8 meters to the right. Record visual data for 2 seconds. Verify data integrity using internal noise filter – set threshold at 0.05 dB.

Analyze Visual Data. Cross-reference current visual data with previous scan data. Calculate spatial displacement of any detected object. Flag any movement exceeding 0.01 meters within the last 2 seconds. Trigger alarm if displacement exceeds 0.01 meters.

If Alarm Triggered: Initiate Secondary Removal Protocol Gamma. Deploy manipulator arm, joint 1 rotation: -20 degrees. Joint 2 rotation: -45 degrees. Extend arm length to 1.7 meters. Precise positioning of manipulator to intercept detected object. Apply a gentle lifting force of 0.5 Newtons for 5 seconds. Monitor object lift.  Verify object is fully detached and suspended.

Capture Object Data. Utilizing secondary optical sensors, record object dimensions: Length=0.08 meters, Width=0.05 meters, Height=0.03 meters. Record color spectrum analysis - primary wavelength: 550 nm. Store data within memory unit 7.

Dispose of Foreign Object. Activate internal disposal unit. Initiate controlled incineration sequence at 800°C for 60 seconds. Monitor exhaust gases – ensure levels below regulatory thresholds (CO2 < 1%, NOx < 0.1%).
Transfer to Mixing Bowl
Initiate Mobility Protocol Alpha-7. Confirm actuator calibration within +/- 0.05 degrees.
Extend Right Arm to 1.2 meters. Verify elbow angle is 115 degrees. Maintain arm extension velocity at 0.15 meters per second.
Adjust Right Wrist Rotation by -3.2 degrees. Monitor rotation speed using internal gyroscope. Target rotation speed: 0.08 radians per second.
Calculate trajectory vector to Mixing Bowl Center. Bowl center coordinates: 0.45 meters forward, 0.2 meters to the right, 0.08 meters above ground. Calculate trajectory using inverse kinematics.
Execute Movement Sequence: Initiate motor commands for Right Arm to move along calculated trajectory. Maintain constant velocity. Monitor displacement every 0.02 seconds.
Upon reaching 0.9 meters from Mixing Bowl Center, pause Right Arm movement. Verify distance to bowl center within +/- 0.01 meters.
Extend Right Arm further, adjusting hand position to align with bowl opening. Bowl opening diameter: 22 centimeters. Precise hand-bowl alignment within 1 centimeter margin.
Lower Right Hand to a height of 28 centimeters above the Mixing Bowl surface. Ensure hand is positioned directly above the bowl opening.
Apply downward force of 15 Newtons. Maintain force continuously until bowl is securely within hand grasp. Monitor pressure sensor readings.
Confirm bowl is securely held. Activate visual confirmation system. Bowl image should be clearly visible within the robot’s visual field. Trigger sensor: Bowl stability indicator – Green.
Add Wet Ingredients
Determine Wet Ingredient Quantities
Initialize Measurement Device: Activate digital scale designated 'Scale-Alpha-7'. Ensure calibration status is 'Nominal' as indicated by the display. Set display unit to ‘grams’.
Locate Container 'Liquid-Base-1'. Identify by visual marker ‘Red-Band-Label’. Position Scale-Alpha-7 directly above the center of the container's base.
Lower Scale-Alpha-7: Slowly descend Scale-Alpha-7’s measurement platform until the bottom surface is precisely 2.5 centimeters above the container’s base. Maintain this position for 3 seconds.
Initiate Measurement: Press and hold the 'Start' button on Scale-Alpha-7. Observe the display. Wait until the reading stabilizes. Note the displayed value – this is the initial weight reading.
Record Initial Weight: Log the displayed weight value (e.g., ‘250.3 grams’) into data log file ‘WetIngredient_Initial_Weight’. Timestamp the entry with the current system time.

Add Liquid Increment: Using a dispensing tool designated ‘Dispenser-Unit-3’, carefully introduce 60.0 milliliters of the designated liquid ('Liquid-Base-1') into the container. Dispenser-Unit-3 should dispense from a height of 30.0 centimeters.
Post-Addition Assessment: After complete addition
Measure New Weight: Press and hold the 'Start' button on Scale-Alpha-7. Observe the display. Wait until the reading stabilizes. Note the displayed value – this is the weight reading after addition.

Record New Weight: Log the displayed weight value into data log file ‘WetIngredient_PostAdd_Weight’. Timestamp the entry with the current system time. Calculate the weight difference between the initial and final readings.

Repeat Steps 4-7: Repeat steps 4-7 a total of three times. Each time, add 60.0 milliliters of ‘Liquid-Base-1’ and record the resulting weight reading. Update the ‘WetIngredient_PostAdd_Weight’ data log file with each reading.
Prepare Wet Ingredients (e.g., soften butter, whisk eggs)
Robot arm initiates movement sequence. Target: Kitchen Countertop, Zone A (designated 0.7 meters from the North wall).
Robot arm adjusts gripper force to 2.5 Newtons. Verify grip strength via tactile sensor feedback. Acceptable range: 2.3 - 2.7 Newtons.
Robot arm grasps one (1) block of unsalted butter (weight: 227 grams, dimensions: 10.2 cm x 5.1 cm x 2.5 cm) from the designated butter container (location: 0.3 meters from the South wall).

Robot arm elevates butter block to a height of 0.15 meters above the countertop surface. Maintain gripper force at 2.5 Newtons. Duration: 2.0 seconds. Monitor temperature of butter block via infrared sensor. Acceptable range: 18°C - 22°C.

Robot arm applies a rotational force of 1.8 Newtons clockwise to the butter block for a duration of 3.5 seconds. Verify rotation via accelerometer data. Rotation angle should achieve a 90-degree turn relative to the original orientation.

Robot arm positions butter block on a designated warming pad (temperature: 40°C, located 0.1 meters from the East wall). Maintain spatial relationship: Distance = 0.05 meters, Angle = 15 degrees relative to the North direction.
Robot arm activates warming pad at 100% power. Monitor warming pad temperature via thermocouple. Acceptable range: 38°C - 42°C. Duration: 60 seconds. Log temperature every 5 seconds.
Robot arm retrieves a stainless steel mixing bowl (diameter: 20 cm, depth: 10 cm) from the designated storage rack (location: 0.9 meters from the West wall).
Robot arm places the mixing bowl on the countertop surface, at a spatial coordinate of (0.5 meters from the North wall, 0.3 meters from the East wall).

Robot arm initiates whisk attachment (electric mixer, power: 220V, 50Hz) connected to the mixing bowl. Set mixer speed to Level 2 (approximately 150 RPM). Monitor mixer speed via encoder feedback. Maintain speed within +/- 5 RPM.
Measure Wet Ingredients Accurately

Robot arm initializes to standby position: Arm joint 1 at 0.0 degrees, joint 2 at 90.0 degrees, joint 3 at 0.0 degrees. Gripper closed, pressure sensor reading 5.2 PSI. Visual confirmation: Target zone illuminated with green light.

Move robot arm to ingredient container 1 (sugar) – Coordinates: X = 15.3 cm, Y = 22.8 cm, Z = 18.7 cm. Approach speed: 15 cm/s.  Duration: 3.1 seconds.  Gripper should maintain a 5.0 degree angle to the container surface.
Activate gripper. Apply downward force of 18.5 PSI on gripper pressure sensor. Duration: 0.5 seconds. Verify gripper pressure reading stabilization at 18.5 PSI.

Lower gripper to the center of sugar container. Precise Z-axis movement: 1.2 cm. Duration: 0.8 seconds.  Maintain a gripper angle of 5.0 degrees. Monitor for container slippage – record any change in container orientation.
Activate measuring device (digital scale). Position scale directly beneath gripper. Duration: 0.2 seconds. Scale zeroed. Confirm scale reads 0.0000 grams.

Slowly lower gripper until the scale reads 100.0 grams.  Movement speed: 2.5 cm/s. Duration: 35 seconds. Monitor scale readings every 0.5 seconds.  Record each reading.  Maintain gripper angle constant at 5.0 degrees.
Once the scale reads 100.0 grams, hold gripper position for 1.0 seconds.  Maintain 18.5 PSI on gripper pressure sensor. Record final scale reading.  Confirm reading stabilizes.
Raise gripper 2.0 cm.  Movement speed: 3.0 cm/s. Duration: 6.7 seconds.  Return to standby position. Gripper closed, pressure sensor reading 5.2 PSI. Target zone illuminates green.
Repeat steps 3-7 with the measuring device and container for the second wet ingredient (milk), adjusting container coordinates to X = 28.1 cm, Y = 19.5 cm, Z = 17.9 cm. Maintain accuracy to 0.1 gram.
Combine Wet Ingredients in Bowl
Initialize Robotic Arm: Activate Joint 1 to a position of 0.0 degrees. Verify position accuracy to within +/- 0.1 degrees using onboard gyroscope. Maintain this position.

Retrieve Ingredient Container 1 (Liquid - Milk): Extend Robotic Arm Joint 2 by 0.3 meters. Rotate Robotic Arm Joint 3 clockwise by 15 degrees. Lower Robotic Arm Joint 4 to a height of 0.7 meters above the designated Bowl Location. Confirm Bowl Location coordinates are 1.2 meters from the Robot's Base, 0.5 meters to the right, and 0.3 meters above the floor. Grasp Container 1 with Gripper 1. Apply a consistent gripping force of 5.2 Newtons. Lift Container 1 0.1 meters from the Bowl Location.

Move Container 1 to Bowl Location: Rotate Robotic Arm Joint 3 clockwise by 27 degrees. Extend Robotic Arm Joint 2 by 0.8 meters. Position Robotic Arm Joint 4 directly above the center of the Bowl Location. Lower Robotic Arm Joint 4 until the Container’s lip is 0.2 meters above the Bowl’s rim. Maintain a stable position for 0.5 seconds.

Initiate Liquid Transfer: Activate Pump 1. Set Pump 1 flow rate to 15 milliliters per second. Hold Container 1 stationary. Allow Milk to flow from Container 1 into the Bowl. Monitor flow rate via sensor 2. Continue transfer for 5 seconds.

Monitor Liquid Level: Utilize Level Sensor 1 (located 0.05 meters above the Bowl’s bottom) to continuously monitor the liquid level within the Bowl. Record the liquid level every 0.1 seconds. Stop Pump 1 when the liquid level reaches 0.95 meters within the Bowl.
Pause Transfer: Immediately cease Pump 1 operation. Hold Container 1 stationary. Maintain this position for 1 second to allow for complete liquid transfer.

Retract Robotic Arm: Rotate Robotic Arm Joint 3 counter-clockwise by 15 degrees. Extend Robotic Arm Joint 2 by 0.3 meters. Raise Robotic Arm Joint 4 to a height of 1.0 meters above the Bowl Location. Withdraw Robotic Arm Joint 4 0.1 meters from the Bowl Location. Return Robotic Arm Joint 3 to 0 degrees. Lower Robotic Arm Joint 4 to its initial position. Release Container 1. Verify Gripper 1 is deactivated.
Mix Dough
Prepare Mixing Bowl
Robot arm initiates movement to designated storage area: Shelf 3, Section B, labeled ‘Mixing Bowls’.
Robot arm adjusts its end effector (gripper) to a pre-defined 90-degree angle.
Robot arm extends the gripper a distance of 0.3 meters from its base. Confirm extension via visual sensor input.

Robot arm lowers the gripper vertically 0.15 meters towards the center of a 10-inch (25.4 cm) stainless steel mixing bowl. Precise target coordinates: X=12.7cm, Y=0cm, Z=17.8cm (relative to bowl center).
Robot arm applies a downward force of 5 Newtons to the mixing bowl’s center for 0.5 seconds. Monitor force sensor readings to ensure consistent pressure.
Robot arm retracts the gripper 0.1 meters from the bowl’s surface. Confirm distance via visual sensor input.
Robot arm initiates a rotating movement of the gripper 90 degrees clockwise. Duration: 0.8 seconds. Verify rotation via visual sensor input.
Robot arm extends the gripper back to its original position 0.1 meters from the bowl’s surface. Confirm distance via visual sensor input.
Robot arm applies a downward force of 5 Newtons to the mixing bowl’s center for 0.5 seconds. Monitor force sensor readings to ensure consistent pressure.
Robot arm retracts the gripper fully, returning to its initial position 0.3 meters from the base. Confirm position via visual sensor input. Task complete.
Measure Flour Accurately

Robot arm initializes to standby position. Arm base located at coordinates X=1.2 meters, Y=-0.8 meters, Z=0.3 meters. Gripper closed, visual confirmation: Gripper sensor reading 0.0001 ohms. Arm joint angles: Shoulder Roll = 0 degrees, Elbow Pitch = 90 degrees, Wrist Roll = 0 degrees.

Robot arm extends vertically upwards. Execute command: ‘Extend Vertical’ for 1.5 seconds. Monitor arm displacement via laser rangefinder. Target displacement: 0.4 meters. Verify final Z-coordinate is 0.4 meters. Record final arm Z-coordinate: 0.4002 meters.

Robot arm rotates 90 degrees clockwise. Execute command: ‘Rotate Clockwise 90 Degrees’. Monitor rotation via integrated gyroscope. Target rotation angle: 90 degrees. Verify final arm orientation: Shoulder Roll = -90 degrees, Elbow Pitch = 90 degrees, Wrist Roll = 0 degrees. Record final arm orientation: Shoulder Roll = -90 degrees, Elbow Pitch = 90 degrees, Wrist Roll = 0 degrees.

Robot arm extends horizontally to target flour container. Execute command: ‘Extend Horizontal’ for 0.8 seconds. Utilize laser rangefinder to determine distance to flour container located at X=2.1 meters, Y=-0.5 meters, Z=0.2 meters. Target distance: 0.9 meters. Verify final arm X-coordinate is 2.1 meters, Y-coordinate is -0.5 meters, and Z-coordinate is 0.2 meters.

Robot gripper opens. Execute command: ‘Gripper Open’ for 0.2 seconds. Gripper opening mechanism activates. Monitor gripper opening angle via rotary encoder. Target opening angle: 90 degrees. Verify final gripper opening angle is 90 degrees. Gripper sensor reading: 0.0000 ohms.

Robot gripper descends to contact flour container. Execute command: ‘Descend Vertical’ for 0.6 seconds. Monitor arm displacement via laser rangefinder. Target displacement: -0.1 meters. Verify final arm Z-coordinate is 0.1 meters. Record final arm Z-coordinate: 0.1005 meters.

Robot gripper applies 2.5 Newtons of pressure to flour container. Execute command: ‘Apply Pressure 2.5N’. Monitor pressure via force sensor. Maintain pressure for 0.3 seconds. Verify pressure reading remains at 2.501 Newtons. Record final pressure: 2.502 Newtons.

Robot gripper maintains pressure while rotating container 180 degrees clockwise. Execute command: ‘Rotate Clockwise 180 Degrees’ for 1.2 seconds. Monitor rotation via integrated gyroscope. Target rotation angle: 180 degrees. Verify final container orientation (based on visual confirmation via camera feed) is opposite the initial orientation.
Robot gripper maintains pressure for 0.5 seconds. Verify pressure reading remains at 2.501 Newtons. Record final pressure: 2.501 Newtons.

Robot gripper retracts. Execute command: ‘Gripper Close’ for 0.4 seconds. Gripper closing mechanism activates. Monitor gripper closing angle via rotary encoder. Target closing angle: 0 degrees. Verify final gripper opening angle is 0 degrees. Gripper sensor reading: 0.0000 ohms.
Measure Liquid Ingredients (e.g., milk, water)

Initialize Robotic Arm: Activate Robotic Arm designated ‘LiquidMeasure-7’ ensuring all joints are in the neutral position (0 degrees). Confirm arm operational status via diagnostic pulse – wait for response signal: ‘ARM_READY’. Duration: 3 seconds.

Locate Container 1: Using visual sensor ‘Sight-A’ (resolution 1920x1080, refresh rate 60Hz), identify the container labeled ‘Milk’. Confirm spatial coordinates of container center: X=0.3 meters, Y=0.15 meters, Z=0.08 meters. Verify container volume is 250 milliliters via internal laser measurement.

Approach Container 1: Extend Robotic Arm segment 1 (length = 0.8 meters) until the end effector (gripper) reaches X=0.25 meters, Y=0.13 meters, Z=0.07 meters. Verify proximity sensor ‘Proximity-1’ reading is within 10 millimeters. Duration: 2 seconds.

Grasp Container 1: Activate gripper ‘Grip-Alpha’ with force setting ‘Force-Medium’ (2 Newtons). Slowly lower end effector until contact with container lip is detected. Confirm tactile sensor ‘Touch-1’ reading exceeds 80% threshold. Maintain contact for 0.5 seconds to establish stable grasp. Duration: 1 second.

Lift Container 1: Slowly raise the container vertically until the top of the container reaches Z=0.12 meters. Monitor internal load cell to ensure container weight (200 grams) is maintained.  Rotation: Maintain orientation of container – no rotational adjustments. Duration: 3 seconds.

Position Above Measuring Vessel: Raise the container vertically until the top surface of the container is 15 millimeters above the center of the measuring vessel. Monitor position via ‘Sight-A’.  Maintain orientation of container – no rotational adjustments. Duration: 2 seconds.

Dispense Liquid: Activate pump ‘Pump-1’ at a flow rate of 5 milliliters per second. Maintain flow rate for 10 seconds. Monitor liquid level in the measuring vessel using ‘Sight-A’. Record liquid volume dispensed (50 milliliters). Duration: 10 seconds.
Stop Dispensing: Deactivate pump ‘Pump-1’. Confirm flow rate is 0 milliliters per second. Duration: 0.5 seconds.

Release Container 1: Slowly retract Robotic Arm segment 1 until the end effector is 50 millimeters above the container lip. Deactivate gripper ‘Grip-Alpha’.  Monitor tactile sensor ‘Touch-1’ until reading falls below 20% threshold. Duration: 2 seconds.
Return to Initial Position: Slowly lower the container to its initial resting position (X=0.3 meters, Y=0.15 meters, Z=0.08 meters). Duration: 3 seconds.
Combine Dry Ingredients in Bowl
Robot arm initiates movement to designated shelf holding container labeled ‘Flour’.
Robot arm extends articulated arm to a position 35 centimeters above the designated bowl (ID: Bowl-001) located on the countertop.  Arm extension angle: 27 degrees relative to the countertop surface.
Robot arm adjusts its grip force to 2.5 Newtons, ensuring a secure but gentle grasp of the container labeled ‘Flour’. Gripper pressure sensor should report 2.6 Newtons.
Robot arm lifts the container labeled ‘Flour’ vertically upwards 15 centimeters.  Lift duration: 0.8 seconds.  Maintain vertical alignment.
Robot arm positions the container labeled ‘Flour’ directly above the center of the bowl (ID: Bowl-001).  Accuracy target: +/- 1 millimeter.
Robot arm lowers the container’s lid (if present) via a 180-degree rotational movement. Rotation speed: 3 radians per second. Lid should fully open.
Robot arm extends its arm to a position 10 centimeters above the bowl's rim (ID: Bowl-001). Arm extension angle: 35 degrees relative to the countertop surface.

Robot arm deposits 80 grams of dry ingredients (pre-identified as ‘Baking Soda’) into the bowl (ID: Bowl-001). Dispensing method: Controlled gravity feed.  Dispense duration: 1.2 seconds. Monitor weight sensor. Confirm weight of 80.1 grams +/- 0.5 grams.
Robot arm retracts its arm 15 centimeters from the bowl. Arm extension angle: 45 degrees relative to the countertop surface. Retraction duration: 1.0 seconds.
Robot arm initiates movement to designated shelf holding container labeled ‘Sugar’.
Robot arm repeats steps 5-9, depositing 120 grams of dry ingredients (pre-identified as ‘Granulated Sugar’) into the bowl (ID: Bowl-001).
Gradually Add Liquid to Dry Ingredients

Initialize Robotic Arm Position: Extend robotic arm to position X=0.5 meters, Y=0.2 meters, Z=0.3 meters. Verify position using onboard laser scanner and adjust as needed to within +/- 0.001 meters. Maintain arm stability with active vibration dampening system at 75% power.

Retrieve Liquid Container: Move robotic arm to X=0.7 meters, Y=0.3 meters, Z=0.2 meters. Gripper open. Approach liquid container (500ml beaker) located at X=0.8 meters, Y=0.4 meters, Z=0.25 meters. Confirm container is clean and free of debris using onboard camera.

Activate Gripper: Initiate gripper closure sequence. Gripper should close within 0.5 seconds, achieving 80% of maximum grip force (10 Newtons). Verify grip stability with force sensor readings. Maintain gripper position at X=0.8 meters, Y=0.4 meters, Z=0.25 meters.

Liquid Extraction: Extend robotic arm to X=0.9 meters, Y=0.5 meters, Z=0.2 meters. Initiate liquid dispensing sequence. Dispense 10 milliliters of dry ingredients (flour) into the awaiting dry ingredient receptacle (500ml container) located at X=0.95 meters, Y=0.45 meters, Z=0.2 meters. Dispensing duration: 2.0 seconds. Monitor liquid flow rate via optical sensor. Maintain flow rate at 5 milliliters per second +/- 0.2 milliliters per second.

Retract Robotic Arm: Initiate robotic arm retraction sequence. Return arm to initial position: X=0.5 meters, Y=0.2 meters, Z=0.3 meters. Verify return path using onboard encoder. Confirm arm position within +/- 0.001 meters. Disable active vibration dampening.

Repeat Steps 3 & 4: Initiate liquid dispensing sequence again. Dispense 15 milliliters of dry ingredients (sugar) into the awaiting dry ingredient receptacle. Dispensing duration: 2.5 seconds. Monitoring flow rate: 6 milliliters per second +/- 0.3 milliliters per second. Ensure smooth transition between dispensing quantities.

Final Retraction: Initiate robotic arm retraction sequence. Return arm to initial position: X=0.5 meters, Y=0.2 meters, Z=0.3 meters. Verify position within +/- 0.001 meters. Confirm completion of dispensing process.

Cleanup: Activate onboard cleaning system. Initiate spray cycle with deionized water. Target the dispensing area with a 30-degree nozzle angle. Spray for 3 seconds. Verify complete removal of dry ingredient residue using onboard camera.
Mix Dough Until Smooth and Elastic

Initialize Mixer: Ensure the stand mixer is powered on and set to the lowest speed, designated 'Speed 1', corresponding to 100 RPM. Verify motor current draw is within the specified range of 300-350 watts. Confirm bowl is securely attached to the mixer base.

Ingredient Measurement - Water: Using a digital scale, precisely measure 350.0 grams of filtered water. Introduce the water into the mixer bowl. Ensure water level is within the marked 'Water Level - 350g' line on the bowl interior. Monitor water temperature; target temperature is 22°C ± 1°C.

Ingredient Measurement - Flour: Using a scoop, precisely transfer 480.0 grams of all-purpose wheat flour (protein content 11-12%) into a separate, calibrated weighing container. Accurately dispense the flour into the mixer bowl. Maintain a consistent, vertical pour to minimize flour displacement.

Initial Mixing - Stage 1: Increase mixer speed to 'Speed 2', corresponding to 250 RPM. Maintain this speed for 60 seconds. Observe the dough's initial state. Record visual observations including color, texture, and presence of any large clumps.

Ingredient Addition - Yeast: Using a digital scale, precisely measure 7.0 grams of active dry yeast. Incorporate the yeast into the mixer bowl. Utilize a rubber spatula to gently fold the yeast into the dough, ensuring complete dispersion. Time this addition and folding process to 10 seconds.

Ingredient Addition - Salt: Using a digital scale, precisely measure 10.0 grams of fine sea salt. Add the salt to the mixer bowl. Immediately initiate a 10-second, slow, circular mixing motion at 'Speed 1'. This action should be performed in a clockwise direction.

Initial Mixing - Stage 2: Increase mixer speed to 'Speed 3', corresponding to 350 RPM. Maintain this speed for 180 seconds. Monitor dough consistency. Record visual observations, including dough elasticity, smoothness, and the absence of dry flour pockets.

Ingredient Addition - Oil: Using a digital scale, precisely measure 60.0 grams of vegetable oil (sunflower or canola). Add the oil to the mixer bowl. Initiate a 30-second, slow, circular mixing motion at 'Speed 1', maintaining a clockwise rotation.

Final Mixing - Stage 3: Increase mixer speed to 'Speed 4', corresponding to 450 RPM. Maintain this speed for 60 seconds. Continuously observe the dough. The dough should exhibit a smooth, elastic texture, demonstrating the absence of large, unmixed pockets. The dough should pull away from the sides of the bowl when lifted with a spatula.

Dough Evaluation: Using a calibrated dough rheometer, perform a 'Shear Force' measurement. Target Shear Force should be between 15-20 Pascals. If this value is outside the range, adjust mixing time by +/- 15 seconds and repeat evaluation.
First Rise
Prepare Dough Mixture: Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl.

Gripper 1 closes to 45 degrees. Gripper 1 force: 5 Newtons. Gripper 1 speed: 0.1 m/s. Duration: 1 second.

Robot arm moves forward 0.1 meters along the x-axis. Arm joint 1 target angle: 0 degrees. Arm joint 2 target angle: 90 degrees. Arm joint 3 target angle: 0 degrees. Gripper 1 open to 10 degrees. Arm speed: 0.2 m/s. Duration: 1 second.

Robot arm extends to designated storage compartment for ‘dry yeast’ container. Verify container identification via visual recognition system – object label ‘Dry Yeast’ must be clearly visible and within 10cm of the robot arm.”
Robot arm manipulates gripper to grasp ‘Dry Yeast’ container. Gripper force calibrated to 2.5 Newtons. Maintain grasp for 0.5 seconds to ensure secure hold.
Robot arm lifts ‘Dry Yeast’ container to a designated placement zone 30cm above the mixing bowl. Vertical displacement measured to within ±1mm using integrated laser rangefinder.
Robot arm lowers ‘Dry Yeast’ container, rotating it 90 degrees clockwise. Rotation angle verified using internal gyroscope – target angle: 90 degrees ±0.5 degrees.

Robot arm extends to designated storage compartment for ‘warm water’ container. Verify container identification via visual recognition system – object label ‘Warm Water’ must be clearly visible and within 10cm of the robot arm.”

Allow Dough to Bloom: Let the dough rest for 5-10 minutes.

Robot arm initiates movement to Mixing Bowl Station. Precise coordinates: X = 1.2 meters, Y = 0.8 meters, Z = 0.9 meters. Movement speed: 0.3 meters/second. Ensure zero angular velocity throughout movement.
Robot arm extends pneumatic gripper to a reach of 0.6 meters. Gripper pressure: 50 Newtons. Verify gripper closure with visual sensor input - target closure: 95%.
Robot arm lowers gripper to center of Dough Heap (designated point: X = 0.5 meters, Y = 0.3 meters, Z = 0.1 meters). Verify position within 0.01 meters of target using laser rangefinder.
Robot arm applies a downward force of 15 Newtons to the Dough Heap for a duration of 2 seconds. Monitor Dough Heap displacement using force sensor. Ensure displacement remains within +/- 0.02mm.
Robot arm retracts gripper to initial position (X = 1.2 meters, Y = 0.8 meters, Z = 0.9 meters) at a speed of 0.4 meters/second. Maintain zero angular velocity.
Activate Ambient Temperature Sensor. Record current temperature. Store value in memory as 'AmbientTemperature'.  Tolerance: +/- 0.5 degrees Celsius.
Activate Timer. Set timer to 600 seconds (10 minutes). Display timer on visual interface. Ensure timer accuracy to within +/- 1 second.
Robot arm remains stationary. Monitor Dough Heap condition via visual sensor (RGB spectrum analysis - target: Slight rise in surface smoothness).
Timer reaches 600 seconds.  Robot arm remains stationary.  Confirm Dough Heap condition via visual sensor (RGB spectrum analysis - target: Slight rise in surface smoothness).
Robot arm remains stationary.  Confirm timer reaches 600 seconds.  Disable Timer. Record timer end time in memory as 'RestEndTime'.
Cover Dough: Place a damp cloth over the dough to prevent drying.
Robot arm initializes to position 3: Positioning Arm Joint 1 at 0.5 degrees, Joint 2 at 2.1 degrees, Joint 3 at 1.8 degrees. Maintain arm stability at 0.1 Newton-meters force.
Robot arm extends to target location: Move robot arm linear axis along X-axis a distance of 25.3 centimeters. Velocity: 50 millimeters per second. Duration: 0.5 seconds.
Robot arm adjusts vertical axis: Raise robot arm vertical axis a distance of 7.6 centimeters. Velocity: 30 millimeters per second. Duration: 0.3 seconds.
Robot arm positions effector: Rotate robot arm effector by 15 degrees clockwise. Duration: 0.2 seconds.
Damp cloth acquisition: Robot arm effector grasps the damp cloth. Ensure grip force is 1.2 Newton-meters. Maintain grip for 0.3 seconds.
Damp cloth placement: Lower the damp cloth directly over the center of the dough. Maintain a vertical alignment with the dough surface within a tolerance of 0.8 millimeters. Duration: 0.2 seconds.

Damp cloth stabilization: Hold the damp cloth stationary for 1.5 seconds. Maintain a force of 0.8 Newton-meters against the dough surface. Monitor surface temperature around the cloth – maintain at 22 degrees Celsius.
Damp cloth confirmation: Analyze image data from the integrated camera. Verify that the damp cloth completely covers the dough surface. Signal completion when overlap percentage is ≥ 95%.
Monitor Dough Rise: Observe the dough for signs of rising (e.g., volume increase, bubbles).

Initialize Camera: Activate optical sensor array designated 'DoughMonitor-01'. Calibrate focal length to 50mm. Adjust white balance to 6500K. Ensure image resolution is set to 1920x1080 pixels. Confirm sensor gain is at 40dB.

Establish Baseline Image: Capture a single image using DoughMonitor-01. Save image as 'Baseline_Frame_001.jpg'. Record timestamp: [Timestamp_001]. Store image in memory bank 'DoughRise_Images'. Maintain camera position: X=100mm, Y=200mm, Z=80mm.

Define Region of Interest (ROI): Using image processing module 'ROI-01', define a circular ROI with a radius of 75mm centered at the point (X=150mm, Y=250mm) within the captured image. Assign ROI ID: ROI-01.

Analyze ROI for Bubble Density: Within ROI-01, count the number of circular regions exhibiting a diameter between 2mm and 5mm. Each region must contain at least one pixel exceeding 75% of the average pixel intensity in that region. Record count as 'BubbleCount_001'. Duration: 5 seconds.
Measure ROI Area: Using image processing module 'Area-01', calculate the area of the ROI. Record area in square millimeters. Store value in memory bank 'ROI_Area'.  Unit of measurement: mm².

Calculate Volume Increase: Using image processing module 'Volume-01', perform 3D reconstruction of the dough within the ROI. Record the initial volume as 'InitialVolume_001'. Store initial volume in memory bank 'DoughVolume_Initial'. Use the previous baseline image as a reference.

Repeat Analysis: Repeat steps 4-7 for a period of 30 seconds, recording data every 1 second. Save each dataset as 'BubbleCount_001_t[timestamp].csv', 'ROI_Area_t[timestamp].csv', and 'DoughVolume_t[timestamp].csv'.

Compare to Baseline: Calculate the percentage change in 'BubbleCount_001' and 'ROI_Area' relative to 'Baseline_Frame_001'. Store these values as 'BubbleIncrease_Percent' and 'AreaIncrease_Percent' respectively.
Threshold Activation: If 'BubbleIncrease_Percent' exceeds 0.2 and 'AreaIncrease_Percent' exceeds 0.1, trigger alarm 'DoughRise_Detected'. Log alarm time: [Timestamp_Alarm].
Shape Dough
Prepare Dough Surface

Initiate Robotic Arm Movement: Extend Robotic Arm Segment 1 to a height of 0.75 meters, maintaining a 10-degree angle relative to the horizontal plane. Verify position using onboard laser rangefinder, confirming distance to target point at (0.0, 0.0, 0.75) meters. Maintain arm stability with integrated dampeners set to Level 3.

Activate Dough Dispensing Mechanism: Engage Dough Dispensing Mechanism. Calibrate dispensing nozzle to a flow rate of 15 milliliters per second, confirmed by pressure sensor reading at 2.3 bar. Ensure nozzle alignment is within +/- 0.1 degrees of the pre-determined target axis (North).

Dough Placement – Phase 1: Initiate Dough Transfer: Lower Robotic Arm Segment 2 to a height of 0.3 meters above the work surface (identified as a 1.2 meter x 0.9 meter stainless steel table). Execute a linear movement of 0.3 meters along the X-axis (positive direction), maintaining a constant velocity of 0.1 meters per second. Duration: 3 seconds.

Dough Placement – Phase 2: Precise Dough Placement: At 0.3 meters along the X-axis, execute a rotational movement of 90 degrees clockwise. Verify nozzle alignment with target location (0.3, 0.0, 0.15) meters using onboard camera feed. Dispense 30 milliliters of dough. Duration: 1 second.

Dough Placement – Phase 3: Repeat Placement: Repeat the linear movement of 0.3 meters along the X-axis, followed by the 90-degree clockwise rotation and 30 milliliter dough dispensing. Repeat this sequence a total of 6 times, creating a rectangular dough area 0.9 meters long and 0.3 meters wide.

Surface Smoothing – Initial Pass: Activate Robotic Arm Segment 3. Extend arm to a height of 0.2 meters above the completed dough area. Implement a circular motion with a diameter of 0.4 meters, moving at a speed of 0.2 meters per second. Apply a gentle downward force of 10 Newtons. Duration: 5 seconds.

Surface Smoothing – Secondary Pass: Retract Robotic Arm Segment 3 to its initial position (0.75 meters). Lower arm to 0.15 meters above the dough surface. Repeat the circular motion with a diameter of 0.3 meters, moving at a speed of 0.15 meters per second. Apply a gentle downward force of 8 Newtons. Duration: 4 seconds.

Final Surface Inspection: Activate onboard camera with high-resolution imaging. Analyze the dough surface for imperfections (tears, unevenness). If imperfections exceed 2 millimeters in size, initiate a ‘repeat smoothing’ loop, restarting from Step 1.
Divide Dough into Portions

Robot arm initiates movement to Dough Location (Designated Area A). Precise coordinates: X=1.2 meters, Y=0.8 meters, Z=0.3 meters. Verify coordinates using integrated laser scanner. Confirmation required before proceeding.
Robot arm adjusts gripper angle to 37.5 degrees. Confirm angle using internal gyroscope. Adjust angle incrementally in 0.5-degree steps until target is achieved. Hold at target for 2.5 seconds.

Robot arm extends gripper towards Dough Mass (Designated: 2.3 kg, Circular Shape, Diameter 20 cm). Distance to Dough: Calculated as 0.95 meters. Approach trajectory: Linear, velocity = 0.15 m/s. Maintain a constant vertical height of 0.1 meters above the Dough surface.

Upon reaching 0.1 meters above the Dough surface, robot arm applies a force of 5 Newtons for 0.8 seconds. This initiates Dough displacement. Monitor Dough displacement using integrated pressure sensor. Data logged to memory unit.
Robot arm retracts gripper 0.3 meters. Monitor Dough movement using visual sensor. Confirm Dough mass has separated into two distinct sections.
Robot arm extends gripper back to initial position (0.3 meters). Apply a force of 6 Newtons for 1.2 seconds. This consolidates the separated Dough sections.
Robot arm retracts gripper 0.2 meters. Verify Dough mass is now a single, consolidated mass. Use visual analysis and tactile sensor feedback.
Robot arm extends gripper 0.1 meters. Apply a force of 4 Newtons for 0.5 seconds. This prepares the Dough for portioning.
Robot arm extends gripper 0.8 meters, applying a force of 7 Newtons for 3.0 seconds. This will divide the Dough into two portions. Precise force and duration are critical for symmetry.
Robot arm retracts gripper 0.3 meters. Monitor the resulting Dough portions using visual and tactile sensors. Record portion dimensions (Length, Width, Height) and mass for each portion.
Press Dough into Desired Shape

Robot arm initializes to standby position. Shoulder joint angle: 0 degrees. Elbow joint angle: 90 degrees. Wrist rotation: 0 degrees. Gripper closed. Position: X=0.0, Y=0.0, Z=0.5 (relative to initial table surface). Temporal delay: 1 second.
Robot arm extends forward. Shoulder joint angle: 20 degrees. Elbow joint angle: 60 degrees. Wrist rotation: 0 degrees. Movement speed: 100 mm/s. Travel distance: 150 mm. Temporal delay: 0.5 seconds.
Robot arm approaches the dough. Precise target location: X=120.0, Y=0.0, Z=0.3 (relative to initial table surface). Confirm target distance: <5 mm. Temporal delay: 0.2 seconds.
Gripper opens. Gripper width: 50 mm. Gripper opening angle: 90 degrees. Gripper closing force: 2 N. Temporal delay: 0.3 seconds.
Robot arm lowers the gripper. Shoulder joint angle: 10 degrees. Elbow joint angle: 45 degrees. Wrist rotation: 0 degrees. Movement speed: 50 mm/s. Travel distance: 80 mm. Temporal delay: 1 second.
Gripper applies downward pressure to the dough. Pressure force: 10 N. Pressure duration: 2 seconds. Dough surface area under pressure: 75 mm² (estimated). Temporal delay: 0.5 seconds.

Robot arm retracts the gripper. Shoulder joint angle: 0 degrees. Elbow joint angle: 90 degrees. Wrist rotation: 0 degrees. Movement speed: 80 mm/s. Travel distance: 100 mm. Temporal delay: 1.5 seconds.

Robot arm returns to standby position. Shoulder joint angle: 0 degrees. Elbow joint angle: 90 degrees. Wrist rotation: 0 degrees. Gripper closed. Position: X=0.0, Y=0.0, Z=0.5 (relative to initial table surface). Temporal delay: 2 seconds.
Roll Out Dough to Thickness

Initiate Dough Preparation Sequence: Confirm dough temperature is between 68°F and 72°F. Verify hydration level is 65-70% via visual assessment. Activate kneading cycle for 2 minutes with a rotational speed of 40 RPM.

Retrieve Rolling Pin: Extend robotic arm to 1.5 meters. Confirm gripper securely grasps rolling pin, applying 15 Newtons of pressure. Rotate arm to align rolling pin axis with the center of the prepared dough, maintaining an angle of 3 degrees relative to the dough's surface.

Initial Rolling Stroke: Execute a forward rolling motion. Extend the rolling pin 30 centimeters from the dough's edge. Apply a consistent downward force of 2.5 Newtons. Execute the rolling motion over a distance of 15 centimeters, maintaining a velocity of 15 centimeters per second. Duration: 2 seconds.

Lateral Roll: Rotate the rolling pin 15 degrees clockwise. Repeat the previous rolling motion, extending the rolling pin to 30 centimeters and executing a forward roll of 15 centimeters at 15 centimeters per second for 2 seconds. Confirm dough surface remains relatively smooth, visually assessed by sensor data (surface roughness < 0.1mm).

Repeat Lateral Roll: Rotate the rolling pin 15 degrees clockwise. Execute a forward rolling motion of 15 centimeters at 15 centimeters per second for 2 seconds. Monitor surface roughness sensor. Confirm data remains within acceptable parameters.

Repeat Lateral Roll: Rotate the rolling pin 15 degrees clockwise. Execute a forward rolling motion of 15 centimeters at 15 centimeters per second for 2 seconds. Monitor surface roughness sensor. Confirm data remains within acceptable parameters.

Final Rolling Stroke: Rotate rolling pin to 180 degrees. Extend the rolling pin 30 centimeters from the dough's edge. Apply a consistent downward force of 2.5 Newtons. Execute the rolling motion over a distance of 15 centimeters at 15 centimeters per second for 2 seconds. Confirm dough surface remains relatively smooth, visually assessed by sensor data (surface roughness < 0.1mm).
Retract Rolling Pin: Immediately reduce the robotic arm's extension to 0 centimeters. Release gripper, applying 0 Newtons of pressure. Confirm rolling pin is fully retracted and stationary.
Adjust Shape as Needed

Initiate Visual Acquisition: Activate optical sensors. Confirm target object (designated 'Target') is within field of view, center aligned horizontally and vertically at 1.2 meters from robot's operational center. Optical sensor gain set to 75%. Stabilization protocol activated for 0.3 seconds.

Calculate Deviation Vectors: Analyze Target's current shape. Using onboard LiDAR scanner, generate three-dimensional point cloud data. Calculate X, Y, and Z coordinate deviations from a predefined 'Ideal Shape' reference point. Record deviation values as ΔX, ΔY, and ΔZ, respectively. Units: millimeters.

Execute Adjustment Action 1: Linear Extension/Retraction – Joint 1: Rotate Joint 1 clockwise by 2.5 degrees. Duration: 1.2 seconds. Maintain consistent torque of 12 Newton-meters. Verify rotation completion with optical sensor feedback: Target shape shift by no more than 0.8mm in ΔX axis.

Execute Adjustment Action 2: Joint 2 – Extend Manipulator Arm: Extend manipulator arm (Joint 2) by 75 millimeters. Movement should be linear and directly perpendicular to the original Target shape. Duration: 0.8 seconds. Record initial manipulator arm position using onboard encoders. Target Shape change should correspond to ΔY axis deviation.

Execute Adjustment Action 3: Joint 3 – Rotation – Counter-Clockwise Rotation: Rotate Joint 3 counter-clockwise by 1.8 degrees. Duration: 1.0 seconds. Torque maintained at 9 Newton-meters. Monitor visual feedback via optical sensor. Verify Target shape change corresponds to ΔZ axis deviation. Limit change to 1.1mm.

Repeat Adjustment Actions 1-3: Repeat Adjustment Actions 1-3 sequentially, each for a duration of 1.0 seconds, with a pause of 0.2 seconds between each action. Maintain visual confirmation of Target shape change within specified tolerance levels (ΔX ≤ 1.5mm, ΔY ≤ 1.3mm, ΔZ ≤ 1.4mm).

Final Verification: Activate optical sensors. Perform a final visual scan of the Target. Record final X, Y, and Z coordinate deviations. Confirm that all deviations are within acceptable tolerances (ΔX ≤ 1.8mm, ΔY ≤ 1.6mm, ΔZ ≤ 1.7mm). If deviations exceed tolerances, initiate error handling protocol (protocol ID: EH-001).
System Shutdown: Disengage all robotic joints. Return manipulator arm to initial position. Disable optical sensors. Activate power-down sequence.

Observe Dough for Increased Volume

Initialize Visual Sensor Array: Activate visual sensors designated 'Sensor A' and 'Sensor B'. Calibration sequence initiated. Confirm sensor synchronization at 1.2 Hz. Record synchronization confirmation signal: 'SYNC_001'.

Position Sensor A: Move robotic arm equipped with Sensor A to X-axis coordinate: 23.7 cm, Y-axis coordinate: 11.5 cm, Z-axis coordinate: 18.9 cm. Maintain arm stability at 0.1 degrees of tilt. Verify alignment with dough surface via visual confirmation.

Sensor A Acquisition: Activate Sensor A's imaging module. Capture a single image at 1.2 Hz. Image resolution: 640x480 pixels. Record image timestamp: 'IMG_001'. Image data storage location: 'Dough_Image_001.raw'.

Position Sensor B: Move robotic arm equipped with Sensor B to X-axis coordinate: 24.1 cm, Y-axis coordinate: 11.8 cm, Z-axis coordinate: 19.2 cm. Maintain arm stability at 0.1 degrees of tilt. Verify alignment with dough surface via visual confirmation.

Sensor B Acquisition: Activate Sensor B's imaging module. Capture a single image at 1.2 Hz. Image resolution: 640x480 pixels. Record image timestamp: 'IMG_002'. Image data storage location: 'Dough_Image_002.raw'.

Image Comparison: Initiate image comparison algorithm. Compare 'Dough_Image_001.raw' and 'Dough_Image_002.raw'. Calculate the Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE) between the two images. Target RMSE value: < 0.05 pixels. Record RMSE value: 'RMSE_001'.

Volume Estimation: Utilizing the comparison data and pre-programmed volume estimation model, calculate the dough volume increase. Output volume increase in cubic centimeters (cm³). Record volume increase: 'VOLUME_001'. Units: cm³.

Data Logging: Log all acquired data – image timestamps, RMSE values, and calculated volume increase – into designated data log file: 'Dough_Observation_Log_001.csv'. Record log entry timestamp: 'LOG_ENTRY_001'.
Sensor Shutdown: Deactivate visual sensors designated 'Sensor A' and 'Sensor B'. Initiate sensor shutdown sequence. Confirmation signal: 'SHUTDOWN_001'.
Check Dough Texture for Bubbles

Initialize Robotic Arm Position: Extend Robotic Arm Segment 1 to a horizontal position. Joint 1 rotation angle: 0.0 degrees. Position X: 0.0 cm. Position Y: -10.0 cm. Position Z: 25.0 cm. Arm extension speed: 50 mm/s. Maintain arm extension for 0.5 seconds.

Locate Dough Sample: Using onboard visual sensor, identify the designated dough sample. Confirm visual match against pre-programmed dough sample ID 'Dough_Sample_Alpha'. Precise location coordinates: X: 1.2 cm, Y: -8.5 cm, Z: 26.1 cm. Adjust Robotic Arm Position to align with these coordinates.

Implement Gentle Lifting Action: Extend Robotic Arm Segment 2. Joint 2 rotation angle: 10.0 degrees. Position X: 1.2 cm. Position Y: -8.5 cm. Position Z: 27.0 cm. Apply a lifting force of 0.5 Newtons. Lift the dough sample 5.0 cm vertically. Maintain this position for 1.0 seconds.

Initiate Texture Scanning: Activate onboard visual sensor with high-resolution mode (100 pixels). Scan the dough sample's surface within a circular area of 5.0 cm radius, centered at the sample's Z-coordinate. Scan speed: 10 pixels/second. Record visual data for 3.0 seconds.

Data Analysis - Bubble Detection: Process visual data using image recognition algorithm (Bubble_Detection_v3.2). Threshold for bubble identification: 15% pixel variance. Report bubble count and size (diameter in pixels) for all detected bubbles.
Repeat Scanning (Optional): If bubble count exceeds pre-defined threshold (5 bubbles), repeat steps 3-5. Otherwise, proceed to the final step.

Record Final Assessment: Log bubble count: [Bubble_Count]. Report bubble diameter range (minimum and maximum pixels). Indicate ‘Bubbles Detected’ or ‘No Bubbles Detected’ based on the bubble count. Store assessment data with timestamp: [Timestamp].
Assess Dough Rise Rate

Initiate Camera Focus: Activate optical sensor array. Adjust focus parameters to achieve a sharp image of the dough rising within the container. Target focus distance: 30 centimeters from sensor center to the highest point of the dough. Verify focus sharpness using a predefined 'sharpness threshold' of 0.8 on the image recognition system. Maintain this focus throughout the assessment.
Record Initial Time: Activate timestamp logging. Record the precise date and time to the millisecond. Timestamp: [Current Date and Time]. Store timestamp in memory unit ‘Time-Millisecond’.

Dough Volume Measurement – Frame 1: Activate volumetric scanner. Capture three-dimensional point cloud data of the dough. Define a spherical volume with a radius of 15 centimeters centered at the container's midpoint. Record the volume of the dough in cubic centimeters. Store result in memory unit ‘Volume-CubicCentimeters’.

Establish Baseline Rise Rate: Wait 60 seconds. Maintain constant ambient temperature at 22 degrees Celsius. Do not introduce external vibrations or disturbances. Monitor the image data for any changes in dough height.
Dough Volume Measurement – Frame 2: Repeat step 5, using the volumetric scanner. Record the volume of the dough. Store result in memory unit ‘Volume-CubicCentimeters’.

Calculate Rise Rate – Frame 1: Analyze data from Frame 1 and Frame 2. Calculate the change in volume (ΔV) in cubic centimeters. Calculate the time difference (ΔT) in seconds between the two measurements. ΔV = Volume-CubicCentimeters-Frame2 - Volume-CubicCentimeters-Frame1. ΔT = Timestamp-Frame2 - Timestamp-Frame1. Store the results in memory unit ‘Rise Rate-CubicCentimetersPerSecond’.
Continue Observation – 180 Seconds: Maintain observation period for 180 seconds, recording data every 10 seconds. Use volumetric scanner to measure dough volume and record timestamp.

Dough Volume Measurement – Final Frame: Activate volumetric scanner. Capture three-dimensional point cloud data of the dough. Define a spherical volume with a radius of 15 centimeters centered at the container's midpoint. Record the final volume of the dough in cubic centimeters. Store result in memory unit ‘Volume-CubicCentimeters’.

Calculate Final Rise Rate: Analyze data from all frames. Calculate the average change in volume (ΔVavg) in cubic centimeters. Calculate the total time difference (ΔTtotal) in seconds. ΔVavg = (Volume-CubicCentimeters-Frame1 + Volume-CubicCentimeters-Frame2 + Volume-CubicCentimeters-Frame3 + Volume-CubicCentimeters-Frame4 + Volume-CubicCentimeters-Frame5) / 5. ΔTtotal = Timestamp-Frame5 - Timestamp-Frame1. Store the results in memory unit ‘Rise Rate-CubicCentimetersPerSecond’.
Note Dough Height and Shape
Initialize Robotic Arm Position: Extend arm to a horizontal position, 30.0 centimeters above the work surface. Wrist rotation set to 0.0 degrees. Grip sensor initialized to 0.0 percentage.

Locate Target Dough: Using visual sensor (camera ID: VIS-001), identify the center point of the dough. Record the X, Y, and Z coordinates of the center point as 15.0 centimeters, 22.5 centimeters, and 8.0 centimeters respectively, with a tolerance of +/- 0.2 centimeters. Confirm center point identification via visual sensor.

Approach Dough: Move robotic arm vertically downwards at a speed of 50.0 millimeters per second until the gripper approaches within 2.0 centimeters of the dough’s surface. Maintain a consistent vertical velocity throughout the approach.

Dough Height Measurement: Activate pressure sensor on gripper. Lower gripper vertically by 1.0 centimeter. Maintain this position for 0.5 seconds. Record the pressure reading from the pressure sensor. This measurement is the initial dough height.

Shape Assessment - Lateral Sweep: Rotate gripper clockwise by 30.0 degrees. Move gripper laterally 5.0 centimeters to the right. Maintain a speed of 30.0 millimeters per second.  Repeat this movement twice, recording the X coordinate for each movement. This will map the dough’s lateral extent.

Shape Assessment - Lateral Sweep: Rotate gripper counter-clockwise by 30.0 degrees. Move gripper laterally 5.0 centimeters to the left. Maintain a speed of 30.0 millimeters per second. Repeat this movement twice, recording the X coordinate for each movement. This will map the dough’s lateral extent.

Retract Gripper: Raise the gripper vertically by 1.0 centimeter.  Return gripper to initial horizontal position (30.0 centimeters above the work surface). Wrist rotation set to 0.0 degrees. Grip sensor initialized to 0.0 percentage.

Data Logging: Record the recorded dough height (8.0 cm +/- 0.2 cm), the minimum X coordinate (recorded during lateral sweep), the maximum X coordinate (recorded during lateral sweep), and the timestamp of the measurement.
Determine if Second Rise is Complete

Initialize Visual Sensor Array: Activate visual sensors designated 'Sensor A', 'Sensor B', and 'Sensor C'. Ensure all sensors are calibrated to a resolution of 1024x768 pixels with a color depth of 24 bits. Record initial sensor readings and store in memory bank 'SensorData_Initial'. Wait 5 seconds for stabilization.

Locate Dough Rise Indicator: Using Sensor A, scan the baking surface. Identify the object designated 'RiseIndicator1'. Measure its precise Euclidean distance from the center of the baking surface. Record distance as 'Distance_RiseIndicator1' (units: millimeters). Confirm distance within a tolerance of +/- 1.5 mm. If outside tolerance, repeat step 3.

Measure Rise Indicator Height: Using Sensor B, measure the vertical height of 'RiseIndicator1' from the baking surface. Record height as 'Height_RiseIndicator1' (units: millimeters). Verify height is between 50 mm and 75 mm. Record this measurement in memory bank 'HeightData'.

Analyze Dough Texture: Activate tactile sensor 'Sensor D' positioned 50 mm directly above 'RiseIndicator1'. Record pressure reading as 'Pressure_RiseIndicator1' (units: Pascals). Maintain pressure for 3 seconds. Note the average pressure reading.

Analyze Crust Color: Using Sensor C, analyze the color of the crust surrounding 'RiseIndicator1'. Sample the color at three points – top, left, and right – relative to 'RiseIndicator1'. Record RGB values for each point: (R1, G1, B1), (R2, G2, B2), (R3, G3, B3). Store these values in memory bank 'ColorData'.

Compare Data to Criteria: Access memory bank 'ColorData'. Compare the average RGB values to the pre-programmed threshold for 'Second Rise Complete' (R: 180-220, G: 140-180, B: 100-140). Also, verify that 'Pressure_RiseIndicator1' is greater than 15 Pascals and 'Height_RiseIndicator1' is between 60 mm and 80 mm. Log comparison results to memory bank 'DecisionData'.

Determine Completion Status: Based on the data stored in 'DecisionData', determine if the criteria for 'Second Rise Complete' have been met. If all criteria are met, set 'CompletionStatus' to TRUE. Otherwise, set 'CompletionStatus' to FALSE. Log final 'CompletionStatus' to memory bank 'FinalStatus'.
Report Status: Send the value of 'CompletionStatus' to central control unit. Record timestamp of completion determination in memory bank 'Timestamp'.
